result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael McNew was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will waive costs and surcharges due to financial instability.
with credit for 1 day.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

defendant.name: McNew, Michael

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Correction: to events of 12/17/15 Motion hearing, Plea/Sentencing court reporter corrected this date per Court Reporting Services. jew

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court will waive costs and surcharges due to financial instability.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Michael McNew in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing. Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to reconsider.

Defendant Michael McNew in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 666
cf

Defendant Michael McNew in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Deputy Douglas Burmeister - MCSD.  Exhibit 1 received.  State rests.  Defense calls no witnesses.  Testimony closed.  Findings by Court.  Court denied defense motion to suppress.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Vehicle Search received and filed.
Defendant Michael McNew in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter to remain on for Motion hearing.

Defendant Michael McNew in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel received all discovery and would like more time to review it before filing a motion.  Court ordered motion to be filed by next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference and motion hearing in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael McNew in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms and Absolute Sobriety.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael McNew in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Protasiewicz.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/31/15 @ 1:30 pm
